ACT
201
Sealing
If it judges that it is expedient, the court may order that the premises where the items from the estate are located be sealed, and it will designate a person who will oblige him to report any damage to the seal without delay to the competent police department and the court.
Permission to remove the seal can only be given by the probate court, that is, by a notary public as a court commissioner.
